page.title: 17Brook House Farm.
page.content: We went to visit Brook House farm on Bean Leach Road.There was a date on the farmhouse saying{1849. Nowadays because of the importance of{horse riding}in the leisure of many people places like this are used to {graze horses}and not produce much food.There are{60}horses.The lady said that her favourite animals are the {goats}because they give milk and eat many weeds. There were{7 dogs and cat.}The farmer owns{160 acres of land.}There were{two old sheep and two lambs together. We were allowed to pick up the lambs after the lady had shown us how to do it properly. The farm had a{thoroughbred horse which was the foal of a{Derby {winner.}It was worth a few thousand pounds. They do not use dogs to guard the farm they use{geese.
